Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2016 09:15PM qiujong wrote: I have had a back and brain MRI. No one can determine the cause of the numbness. My doctor cannot attribute my numbness to Fulvestrant; however, she will not say it is not possible. I don't think anyone truly knows.
Posts.Title: numbness in legs/Fulvestrant injections qiujong qiujong

Posts.Content: qiujong wrote: I have been receiving Fulvestrant for several years. I have numbing on the outside of my upper left thigh and parts of my lower right leg. I am wondering if anyone else has numb spots, possibly from the needles? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: numbness in legs/Fulvestrant injections qiujong qiujong

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2016 09:13PM qiujong wrote: Also, I went to a chiropractor, and, in doing a pain/sensitivity test, he pressed on the back of my thighs. Both are very sensitive and feel exactly like touching a bruise. I said the same thing.
Posts.Title: numbness in legs/Fulvestrant injections qiujong qiujong

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2016 09:11PM qiujong wrote: My doc told me outer thigh numbness is common. When I asked if it happened from one particular shot or over a period of time, she said, "I have seen both." There is a spot on my right outer thigh where I cannot feel a thing.
